intro: Anemonospermos glabrata, commonly known as the smooth anemonosperma, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Anemonospermataceae. It is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, yellowish flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its roots are fibrous and can form dense colonies, contributing to soil stabilization. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
